metadata.title: CVE-2009-4496 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
Boa 0.94.14rc21 writes data to a log file without sanitizing non-printablecharacters, which might allow remote attackers to modify a window's title,or possibly execute arbitrary commands or overwrite files, via an HTTPrequest containing an escape sequence for a terminal emulator.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

boa - 0.94.14rc21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: boa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.94.14rc21').
